title: Salix 'Golden Curls' (Agrentina, 1971) Photo: F.D.Richards, SE Michigan, 4/2021 - Corkscrew Willow
description: Salix 'Golden Curls' (Agrentina, 1971) Photo: F.D.Richards, SE Michigan, 4/2021 - Corkscrew Willow, Mature size: 30x15â€™, -, USDA Hardiness Zone 4, In Garden Bed D5 for 24.0 YEARS (Builders). Planted in 1997. This cultivar is apparently a hybrid between S. alba 'Tristis' and S. matsudana 'Tortuosa'. Found in Agrentina and introduced around 1971 (Dirr, 1998). Syn. S. matsudana 'Golden Curls' and S. erythroflexuosa. Aka Corkscrew Willow, Contorted Willow, Dragon's Claw Willow. Looks to be declining for the past couple of years. Additional photos of this plant from 2015, 16, 17, 18, 21: www.flickr.com/search/?user_id=50697352%40N00&sort=da...
label: Original
